intro: Knautia drymeja subsp. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower heads that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
